verses.text: When the LORD your God brings you into the land which you are entering to possess and drives out many nations before you—the Hittites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, seven nations greater and mightier than you—
verses.comment: Repetitive list of the seven nations preserved as in original Hebrew.

verses.text: and when the LORD your God gives them over to you, and you defeat them, you must utterly destroy them. You shall make no covenant with them and show no mercy to them.
verses.comment: Phrase 'utterly destroy' translates the Hebrew herem, signifying complete destruction dedicated to the LORD.

verses.text: You shall not intermarry with them. You shall not give your daughter to their son, nor shall you take their daughter for your son.
verses.comment: Faithfully represents the marriage prohibitions in the original.

verses.text: For they will turn your children away from following Me, to serve other gods. Then the anger of the LORD will be kindled against you, and He will quickly destroy you.
verses.comment: Warning of apostasy preserved.

verses.text: But this is how you shall deal with them: you shall tear down their altars, break their sacred pillars, cut down their Asherah poles, and burn their carved images with fire.
verses.comment: 'Asherah poles' translates the Hebrew word 'asherim', sacred wooden symbols.

verses.text: For you are a people holy to the LORD your God. The LORD your God has chosen you to be a people for His treasured possession, out of all the peoples who are on the face of the earth.
verses.comment: 'Treasured possession' closely follows Hebrew 'am segulah'.

verses.text: The LORD did not set His love on you or choose you because you were more in number than any other people, for you were the fewest of all peoples;
verses.comment: 'Set His love on you' reflects the original idiom.

verses.text: but because the LORD loved you, and because He kept the oath which He swore to your fathers, the LORD has brought you out with a mighty hand and redeemed you from the house of slavery, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
verses.comment: 'House of slavery' closely follows the literal Hebrew.

verses.text: Know therefore that the LORD your God, He is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and steadfast love with those who love Him and keep His commandments to a thousand generations,
verses.comment: 'Steadfast love' translates 'hesed'.

verses.text: and repays those who hate Him to their face, to destroy them. He will not be slack with him who hates Him; He will repay him to his face.
verses.comment: Phrase 'to their face' implies openly, directly.

verses.text: Therefore you shall keep the commandment, the statutes, and the rules which I command you today, to do them.
verses.comment: Literal rendering of commandment terms.

verses.text: And because you listen to these judgments and keep and do them, the LORD your God will keep with you the covenant and the steadfast love which He swore to your fathers.
verses.comment: 'Judgments' translates the Hebrew 'mishpatim'.

verses.text: He will love you, bless you, and multiply you. He will also bless the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your land—your grain, your wine, and your oil—the increase of your herds and the young of your flock, in the land that He swore to your fathers to give you.
verses.comment: 'Womb,' 'grain,' 'wine,' 'oil' are literal translations of the Hebrew terms.

verses.text: You shall be blessed above all peoples. There shall not be male or female barren among you or among your livestock.
verses.comment: Masculine and feminine terms preserved per Hebrew.

verses.text: And the LORD will take away from you all sickness, and will put none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which you knew, on you, but will lay them on all who hate you.
verses.comment: Literal references to 'evil diseases of Egypt.'

verses.text: You shall consume all the peoples whom the LORD your God gives over to you. Your eye shall not pity them; neither shall you serve their gods, for that would be a snare to you.
verses.comment: 'Eye shall not pity' is a Semitic idiom preserved.

verses.text: If you say in your heart, 'These nations are greater than I; how can I dispossess them?'
verses.comment: Hebraic phrase 'say in your heart' means 'think to yourself.'

verses.text: you shall not be afraid of them, but you shall remember what the LORD your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt,
verses.comment: Imperative phraseology from Hebrew rendered directly.

verses.text: the great trials that your eyes saw, the signs, the wonders, the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm by which the LORD your God brought you out. So shall the LORD your God do to all the peoples of whom you are afraid.
verses.comment: 'Mighty hand, outstretched arm' are idioms for God's power.

verses.text: Moreover the LORD your God will send hornets among them, until those who are left and hide themselves from you perish.
verses.comment: 'Hornets' may refer either to literal insects or as a symbol of panic and terror.

verses.text: You shall not be terrified of them, for the LORD your God is in your midst, a great and awesome God.
verses.comment: 'Awesome' reflects the fearsome aspect of God in Hebrew.

verses.text: The LORD your God will clear away these nations before you little by little. You will not be allowed to exterminate them all at once, lest the wild animals become too numerous for you.
verses.comment: Sequence of destruction is gradual, as in original.

verses.text: But the LORD your God will give them over to you and throw them into great confusion, until they are destroyed.
verses.comment: 'Throw them into great confusion' is a literal rendering.

verses.text: He will give their kings into your hand, and you will make their name perish from under heaven. No one shall be able to stand against you until you have destroyed them.
verses.comment: 'Make their name perish from under heaven' is a Hebrew expression for total defeat.

verses.text: The carved images of their gods you shall burn with fire. You shall not covet the silver or gold that is on them nor take it for yourselves, lest you be ensnared by it, for it is an abomination to the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Specifics of idolatrous images and the associated treasures preserved.

verses.text: And you shall not bring an abominable thing into your house and become devoted to destruction like it; you shall absolutely loathe it and utterly abhor it, for it is devoted to destruction.
verses.comment: 'Devoted to destruction' translates 'herem', dedicated for destruction.
